titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Homes of New Jersey Women's Auxiliary records 1975-1981
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Homes of New Jersey Women's Auxiliary records

bioghist.p: Presbyterian Homes of New Jersey provided funding for the operation of two senior residential facilities in New Jersey. One was located at 123 S. Illinois Avenue in Atlantic City and the other was at 132 Warwick Road in Haddonfield. The Woman's Auxiliary published a monthly newsletter, the Presbyterian Homes Report.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of copies of the monthly Presbyterian Homes Report, from 1975 to 1981 (several issues missing). The newsletters include reports on the activities at Madison House and Haddonfield Home and brief reports from several local Presbyteries.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
